CatDescriptText: Louis B. Gideon, messenger, East Liberty and Hosea Moore, steelworker, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. A1 question reads: Do you think religion will play a major part in the choosing of the presidential candidate? If so, why?" Gideon's answer reads: "I really believe that it will.  There never has been a Catholic President." Moore's answer reads: "I don't think that it should, but it probably will.  We have never had a Catholic President and many persons are against Kennedy because he is a Catholic."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Louis B. Gideon wearing textured suit jacket and hat with striped band, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Hosea Moore wearing checkered button down collared shirt with embroidered flags on breast pocket and sunglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
